**English III: Literature and Culture**

**Spring 2022**

I. **Goals**

The goal of this course is to provide students with a reasonably compact introduction to the study of the social, historical, cultural, and personal issues rendered and explored in contemporary literary works. The selected works will be explored in terms of basic aesthetic elements and critical approaches so as to heighten students’ sensibility of the various dimensions of literary works. Reading literary texts alongside some significant and universal themes is meant to help students develop an in-depth view of literary works as aesthetic expressions of contested social, political, and cultural conditions and as an important means for looking into the complexity of humanity and the human conditions.

II. **Course Requirements and Grading Policy**

1.  **Reading Assignments:** You are expected to complete readings before coming to class.
2.  **Attendance and Participation (20%):** Attendance and participation in class are required. Be punctual for class and send a notice to the instructor when you cannot attend a class meeting. More than three unexcused absences will result in an F in your final grade. Discussing these texts with the instructor and your peers will enhance your understanding of the texts.
3.  **Oral Presentation (20%):** You will be expected to give a 15-minute class presentation on the book you choose.
4.  **Midterm Exam (20%):** Questions are based on information provided in the text.
5.  **Final Exam (20%):** Questions are based on information provided in the text.
6.  **Term Paper (20%):** A properly formatted paper of more than 2 pages is due on the last day of class.
